title: What are the effects of liberalization? - Quora

response.answer_text: It made more people wealthier and healthier than before. Previous to “liberalization” the world existed with Lords and serfs, Nobles and vassals, Masters and slaves. If you were lucky enough to be born with a silver spoon in your mouth, you will live a life of ease and luxury. If not, you’ll live hand-to-mouth doing backbreaking work and die before you’re 30. (I’m generalizing, of course) When people came around to setting up “liberalization”, they can actually have decent lives, have some free time for art and leisure, and more importantly, have optimism that there’s a future for them and their children and children’s children.

Its created generations of people that are quite frankly soft. They’re more concerned with taking care of anyone cradle to grave. Everyone has to be nice and respectful of everyone else. You’re not allowed to be yourself because that’s too offensive. They feel anyone that has nationalistic pride is a threat because they want to move into this one world nirvana that’s a naive fantasy. For someone that doesn’t embrace it, it’s ruining it.
